summary:
We need to produce JSON with keys: summary, business_intent, keywords (list). Must not list method names verbatim. Focus on class responsibility and state/behavior. Provide English.

We have class ClvpEncoderConfig: configuration class for CLVP encoder (text or speech). Stores hyperparameters: vocab size, hidden size, intermediate size, projection dim, number of layers, attention heads, activation, layer norm epsilon, dropout rates, rotary embedding flag, attention bias flag, summary pooling type, initializer factor, BOS/EOS token ids. Inherits from PretrainedConfig. Used to instantiate encoder with given arguments; defaults match susnato/clvp_dev model.

So summary: configuration container for CLVP encoder, defines architecture hyperparameters and token IDs, controls model initialization and output behavior.

Business intent: Provide a flexible way for developers to configure and instantiate CLVP encoder models for text or speech tasks, enabling reproducible setups and customization of model size, attention, pooling, etc., within the Transformers ecosystem.

Keywords: configuration, CLIP-like voice processing (CLVP), encoder, transformer, hyperparameters, vocab size, hidden size, attention heads, dropout, rotary embedding, pooling strategy, token IDs, pretrained model.

Make sure not to list method names.

Now produce JSON.

Need to start with {{ and end with }}? The instruction says "Output ONLY valid JSON starting with {{ and ending with }}. Example: {{\"summary\": \"...\", \"business_intent\": \"...\", \"keywords\": [\"k1\", \"k2\"]}}". So they want double curly braces? That's unusual but they gave example. So we must output exactly with double braces at start and end. Provide JSON inside.

Let's craft.

{
 "summary": "...",
 "business_intent": "...",
 "keywords": [...]
}

But with double braces: {{ ... }}.

Let's produce.

Check for proper escaping of quotes.

Will produce:

{{"summary": "Configuration class that encapsulates all hyperparameters and settings required to build a CLVP encoder model, including vocabulary size, layer dimensions, attention configuration, activation, dropout, rotary embeddings, pooling strategy, and special token identifiers.", "business_intent": "Enable developers to easily create, customize, and reproduce CLVP encoder instances for text or speech processing within the Transformers framework, allowing fine‑tuned control over model architecture and initialization.", "keywords": ["configuration", "CLVP encoder", "transformer", "hyperparameters", "vocab size", "hidden size", "attention heads
